questions.question: Which of the following lines are drawn as dashed narrow lines?
questions.explanation: Hidden outlines are represented using dashed narrow lines to indicate invisible edges.

questions.question: _______ can be used for drawing circles of larger diameters.
questions.explanation: A lengthening bar compass extends the radius to draw larger circles easily.

questions.question: Which of the following tool is used to draw parallel, perpendicular and angular lines?
questions.explanation: Mini drafter combines the functions of set square and T-square for drawing all types of lines.

questions.question: What is the standard trimmed size of the sheet designation A2 in mm?
questions.explanation: According to ISO standards, A2 sheet size is 420 × 594 mm.

questions.question: While drawing the border lines, spacing is more on the ____ side.
questions.explanation: Extra space is left on the left side for binding or filing purposes.

questions.question: Which of the following pencil grade is used to draw visible edges and outlines?
questions.explanation: H-grade pencil gives a clean and slightly dark line suitable for visible outlines.

questions.question: What is the standard size of a title block in mm as recommended by the B.I.S?
questions.explanation: BIS recommends 185 × 65 mm as the standard size for title blocks on drawings.

questions.question: The angle between the hatching lines and the reference lines should be _____.
questions.explanation: Hatching lines are conventionally drawn at 45° to the reference axis.

questions.question: Which of the following details is not mentioned in the title block?
questions.explanation: Sheet size is not listed in the title block because it is standard and predefined.

questions.question: What is the edge of the board called on which the T-square is made to slide?
questions.explanation: The working edge ensures proper alignment of the T-square while drawing.
